identificationModule.briefTitle: The Clinical Effect of MK0476 With Concomitant Administration of and Removal of Inhaled Beclomethasone in Asthmatic Patients (0476-029)
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Multicenter, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Double-Blind, 2-Period, Parallel-Group Study to Assess the Clinical Effect of MK0476 With Concomitant Administration of and Removal of Inhaled Beclomethasone in Asthmatic Patients

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study will investigate the additive effect of montelukast (MK0476) taken along with inhaled beclomethasone versus inhaled beclomethasone alone.

interventions.name: montelukast sodium
interventions.description: 10 mg tablet taken once daily at bedtime for 16 weeks

interventions.name: beclomethasone
interventions.description: 200 ug inhaled, taken twice daily for 16 weeks

interventions.name: Placebo inhaler
interventions.description: placebo inhaler taken twice daily for 16 weeks

interventions.name: placebo tablet
interventions.description: placebo tablet taken once daily at bedtime for 16 weeks

primaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Percent Change From Baseline in Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1) in Patients With Chronic Asthma
primaryOutcomes.description: Mean percent change from baseline in FEV1 in patients with chronic asthma averaged over 16 weeks for the Beclo and MK+ Beclo groups and averaged over last 10 weeks for the Placebo and MK groups
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline & over 16 weeks for the Beclomethasone (Beclo) and Montelukast (MK) + Beclo groups and over last 10 weeks for the Placebo and MK groups

primaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Daytime Symptom Score on the Daytime Asthma Symptoms Diary in Patients With Chronic Asthma
primaryOutcomes.description:
The daily daytime symptom score was determined by averaging the daily scores (the patient scored his/her symptoms \[from 0 (best) to 6 (worst)\] on a daily basis.) for the four questions on the Daytime Asthma Symptoms Diary.

The average daytime symptom score for the visit was determined by averaging the daily symptom scores over all days between two consecutive visits.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline & over 16 weeks for the Beclo and MK + Beclo groups and over last 10 weeks for the Placebo and MK groups

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Percent Change From Baseline in Total Daily Beta-agonist Medication Use
secondaryOutcomes.description: Beta-agonist medication use from the daytime and overnight asthma symptoms diaries for each 24-hour period was added to determine the daily total number of puffs used. The average daily number of puffs for the visit was determined as the average daily number of puffs over all days between consecutive visits.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline & over 16 weeks for the Beclo and MK + Beclo groups and over last 10 weeks for the Placebo and MK groups

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Morning Peak Flow Rate (PEFR) in Patients With Chronic Asthma
secondaryOutcomes.description: Morning PEFR was measured in triplicate immediately upon arising before taking any medication and the best value recorded on the overnight asthma symptoms diary. The mean morning PEFR for the visit was determined by averaging all valid PEFR measurements for the days between consecutive visits.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline & over 16 weeks for the Beclo and MK + Beclo groups and over last 10 weeks for the Placebo and MK groups

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Nocturnal Asthma Score on the Overnight Asthma Symptoms Diary in Nocturnal Asthmatic Patients Only
secondaryOutcomes.description:
Mean change from baseline in Nocturnal asthma score; the patient scored his/her symptoms \[from 0 (best) to 3 (worst)\] on a daily basis. Responses to the question, "Did you wake up with asthma symptoms?" (no, once, more than once, awake "all night"), were assigned numerical values (0, 1, 2, 3, respectively).

The average score for the visit was determined by averaging the daily scores over all days between consecutive visits.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline & over 16 weeks for the Beclo and MK + Beclo groups and over last 10 weeks for the Placebo and MK groups

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Female patients tested negative for pregnancy and agreed to use appropriate contraceptives through out the study
* Patient was a nonsmoker
* Patient was in good general health (except for asthma)

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patient was hospitalized
* Patient was female who was less than 8 weeks postpartum or breast feeding
* Patient planned to move or vacation away during the study
* Patient had major surgery within 4 weeks the past 4 weeks
* Patient has donated blood or participated in a clinical trial within the past 4 weeks
* Patient was a regular user or recent abuser of alcohol or illicit drugs
* Patient was 40% over or under normal weight for height

references.citation: Laviolette M, Malmstrom K, Lu S, Chervinsky P, Pujet JC, Peszek I, Zhang J, Reiss TF. Montelukast added to inhaled beclomethasone in treatment of asthma. Montelukast/Beclomethasone Additivity Group. Am J Respir Crit Care Med. 1999 Dec;160(6):1862-8. doi: 10.1164/ajrccm.160.6.9803042.

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: Patients received inhaled beclomethasone (200 μg twice daily) starting at the Prestudy Visit and continuing through the single-blind run-in period. Patients who experienced worsening asthma requiring more than albuterol therapy (inhaled or nebulized) did not qualify for randomization.
participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails:
Patients were recruited at 22 sites in the United States (US) and 48 sites in 16 other countries in North America, Europe, Africa, Australia, and Southeast Asia.

Publication incorrectly listed 18 participating countries. Results posting is correct with 17 countries.

Prime therapy period: March 1995 to April 1996.

groups.title: Placebo
groups.description: Montelukast (MK) placebo tablet orally once daily at bedtime. Beclomethasone (beclo) inhaler was removed in a blinded, two-step procedure over 4 weeks (wks): beclomethasone inhaler 4 puffs (50 μg/puff) upon arising (Weeks 1 to 2)) and 4 puffs (50 μg/puff) at bedtime (Weeks 1 to 4); beclomethasone placebo inhaler 4 puffs upon arising (Weeks 3 to 16) and 4 puffs at bedtime (Weeks 5 to 16). Albuterol inhaler as needed.

groups.title: Montelukast
groups.description: MK 10 mg tablet orally once daily at bedtime. Beclomethasone was removed in a blinded, two-step procedure over 4 weeks: beclomethasone inhaler 4 puffs (50 μg/puff) upon arising (Weeks 1 to 2) and 4 puffs (50 μg/puff) at bedtime (Weeks 1 to 4); beclomethasone placebo inhaler 4 puffs upon arising (Weeks 3 to 16) and 4 puffs at bedtime (Weeks 5 to 16). Albuterol inhaler as needed.

groups.title: Beclomethasone
groups.description: MK placebo tablet orally once daily at bedtime and beclomethasone inhaler 4 puffs (50 μg/puff) upon arising and 4 puffs (50 μg/puff) at bedtime for 16 Weeks. Albuterol inhaler as needed.

groups.title: Montelukast+ Beclomethasone
groups.description: MK 10 mg tablet orally once daily at bedtime and beclomethasone inhaler 4 puffs (50 μg/puff) upon arising and 4 puffs (50 μg/puff) at bedtime for 16 Weeks. Albuterol inhaler as needed.

achievements.comment: Efficacy in last 10 wks to minimize confounding effect of beclo in 1st 4 wks \& allow beclo washout.
Efficacy in last 10 wks to minimize confounding effect of beclo in 1st 4 wks \& allow beclo washout.
Efficacy analyses were over the 16 weeks of treatment.
Efficacy analyses were over the 16 weeks of treatment.

groups.description: Total of all reporting groups

measures.title: Daytime symptom score
measures.description:
Daytime symptom score: The patient scored his/her symptoms \[from 0

(best) to 6 (worst)\] on a daily basis.

measures.description:
Nocturnal asthma score: The patient scored his/her symptoms \[from 0 (best)

to 3 (worst)\] on a daily basis.

measures.title: Total daily Beta-agonist use
measures.description: Number of inhalations (Puffs) of beta-agonist medication

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Percent Change From Baseline in Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1) in Patients With Chronic Asthma
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean percent change from baseline in FEV1 in patients with chronic asthma averaged over 16 weeks for the Beclo and MK+ Beclo groups and averaged over last 10 weeks for the Placebo and MK groups
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Primary efficacy analyses were based on the intention-to-treat principle, i.e., inclusion of all patients with a baseline and at least one postbaseline measurement. No missing values were imputed. Data collected during discontinuation and unscheduled visits were included the analysis. Differences between treatments are evaluated based on LS means
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline & over 16 weeks for the Beclomethasone (Beclo) and Montelukast (MK) + Beclo groups and over last 10 weeks for the Placebo and MK groups

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: Over 16 weeks of treatment and for 14 days post-treatment

eventGroups.title: Placebo
eventGroups.description: Montelukast (MK) placebo tablet orally once daily at bedtime. Beclomethasone (beclo) inhaler was removed in a blinded, two-step procedure over 4 weeks (wks): beclomethasone inhaler 4 puffs (50 μg/puff) upon arising (Weeks 1 to 2)) and 4 puffs (50 μg/puff) at bedtime (Weeks 1 to 4); beclomethasone placebo inhaler 4 puffs upon arising (Weeks 3 to 16) and 4 puffs at bedtime (Weeks 5 to 16). limitationsAndCaveats.description: Efficacy over 16 weeks of treatment for Beclo and MK+Beclo groups, and last 10 weeks for Placebo and MK groups to minimize confounding effect of beclo in 1st 4 weeks of treatment and to allow beclo washout.

certainAgreement.otherDetails: Merck agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Merck supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

pointOfContact.title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development

ancestors.term: Hormones, Hormone Substitutes, and Hormone Antagonists
